summary: This document is a court filing, likely a defense motion or exhibit, requesting the production of documents related to the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) for Jeffrey Epstein and communications between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors. It seeks internal government communications and unredacted correspondence to understand the negotiation of the plea deal and subsequent investigative decisions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement is the subject of the document request. The request seeks all communications concerning the negotiation of this agreement.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as a subject of meetings between victim attorneys and SDNY prosecutors, particularly regarding a declined investigation in 2016.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Listed as one of the attorneys representing accusing witnesses who met with SDNY prosecutors to push for an investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

Edwards is an attorney representing accusing witnesses (victims) against Epstein, actively seeking prosecution.
Edwards is an attorney representing accusing witnesses (victims) against Maxwell, actively seeking prosecution.

events.title: Signing of Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with the government, a central subject of the document request.

events.title: Victim Attorneys Meet with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: A group of attorneys representing accusing witnesses met with SDNY prosecutors to ask them to initiate a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, which was declined.

events.title: SDNY Investigation into Epstein and Maxwell Begins
events.description: The government asserts that the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell began around this time.

events.title: Government Production of NPA Correspondence
events.description: The government previously produced redacted copies of emails and correspondence concerning the NPA negotiation on this date.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
United States Attorney's Office for Southern District of New York (SDNY)
keyFacts: The document is a formal request for all communications concerning the negotiation of Jeffrey Epstein's September 24, 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
It seeks records of meetings in 2016 where victim attorneys asked the SDNY to investigate Epstein and Maxwell, a request that was initially declined.
It references a prior production of NPA-related correspondence by the government on August 13, 2020, but demands unredacted copies.
The request aims to uncover the internal government deliberations and communications that led to the controversial plea deal and subsequent investigative decisions.
